alert.note: Alert for Golden Valley; Stillwater; Sweet Grass (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 9:06PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central and south central Montana, including the following counties, in central Montana, Golden Valley. In south central Montana, Stillwater and Sweet Grass. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas is likely, along with rises in small streams and normally dry coulees. Overflowing poor drainage areas may result in water flowing over rural roads. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 902 PM MDT, Doppler radar continues to indicate areas of moderate to locally heavy rainfall spread across the advisory area. Some locations have seen over 3 inches of rainfall so far, with additional accumulations likely over the next few hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Big Timber, Greycliff, Melville, Reed Point and Rapelje. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Rural roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
